definition: festival/holiday/node/joint/section/segment/part/to economize/to save/to abridge/moral integrity/classifier for segments, e.g. lessons, train wagons, biblical verses/CL:個|个[ge4]
see 節骨眼|节骨眼[jie1 gu5 yan3]
to make an appointment/to invite/approximately/pact/treaty/to economize/to restrict/to reduce (a fraction)/concise
to weigh in a balance or on a scale

sentences.english: The principle of diligence and frugality applies to all undertakings.
sentences.chinese: 勤儉節約的原則適用於一切事業。

sentences.english: Hardworking and thrift are admirable traditional elements of the Chinese nation.
sentences.chinese: 勤儉節約是民族的優良傳統。

sentences.english: Competition to be held in ensuring the successful premise, thriftiness , savings.
sentences.chinese: 在保證比賽圓滿舉行的前提下，勤儉節約，節省經費。

sentences.english: But there is more to it than pleasant weather and belt-tightening.
sentences.chinese: 然而除了好天氣和勤儉節約之外，還有更多的原因。

sentences.english: Protect public assets; treasure resources, be diligent & thrifty, and be committed to common development.
sentences.chinese: 愛護公物，珍惜資源，勤儉節約，共同發展。

sentences.english: Working hard and frugal are both virtues.
sentences.chinese: 艱苦奮鬥和勤儉節約均是美德。

sentences.english: We should cultivate the good habits of diligence and frugality.
sentences.chinese: 我們要養成勤儉節約的好風氣。

definition: lit. ten thousand strings of cash in money belt (idiom); carrying lots of money/extremely wealthy/loaded
rich peasant/social class of people farming their own land, intermediate between land-owner class 地主[di4 zhu3] and poor peasant 貧農|贫农[pin2 nong2]
to die without a burial site/to die a pauper/a tragic end
pinyin: si3 wu2 zang4 shen1 zhi1 di4

definition: to extort under false pretenses/to blackmail/to bluff/to defraud
